body:
## Added
- Another way how to inject InAppChatActionBarProvider to InAppChatFragment.

## Fixed
- Corrupted notification icon resource in demo application

## Added
- InAppChat multithread support

## Changed
- Android Gradle Plugin version is updated to 7.2.2

## Added
- Android 13 support, check the [Migration guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide#migration-from-6x-to-7x)

name: 7.0.0-rc1
body:
## Added
- New Inbox API. Read more: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Inbox
- Android 13 support, check the [Migration guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide#migration-from-6x-to-7x)

## Fixed
- Minor fix for opening webView by tap on the notification

## Changed
- PendingIntents will have FLAG_IMMUTABLE instead of FLAG_MUTABLE for all cases except action with input is set in the category for [interactive notification](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Interactive-notifications#actions-with-input)
- For PendingIntents FLAG_CANCEL_CURRENT updated to the FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT

## Fixed
- Minor bug in InAppChat

## Added
- InAppChat can send contextual / meta data to Conversations backend.

## Fixed
- Minor bug in InAppChat attachment

## Fixed
- Minor bugs in InAppChat attachment

name: 6.5.0-rc1
body:
## Added
- New Inbox API. Read more: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Inbox

## Fixed
- InAppChat add attachment fix

## Fixed
- Corrected wrong Ukrainian localization

## Added
- InAppChat now supports multi-language selection

## Changed
- Silent messages display in chat module is disabled

## Fixed
- Issue with missing "exported" flag on NotificationActionTapReceiver (affecting Android 12 devices)

## Added
- New module for [ECB Cryptor Migration](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/ECB-Cryptor-migration), you don't need to add `ECBCryptorImpl` class if you want to migrate, just add dependency `com.infobip:infobip-mobile-messaging-android-cryptor-migration:6.2.0.@aar` and use `org.infobip.mobile.messaging.cryptor.ECBCryptorImpl`

## Added
- [Requesting Geo permissions automatically](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Requesting-Geo-permissions-automaticaly)

## Documents to check
- [Migration Guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide#migration-from-5x-to-6x)
- [Applying Firebase configuration in MobileMessaging SDK](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Applying-Firebase-configuration-in-MobileMessaging-SDK)

## Changed
- Migrated to AndroidX
- firebase-messaging version changed to 22.0.0
- play-services-location version to 18.0.0

## Security improvements
- removed deprecated ECBCryptor from SDK, if you need to migrate check [ECB Cryptor Migration Guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/ECB-Cryptor-migration)
- `withPrivateSharedPrefs()`: Deprecated at 6.0.0 version, all data saved to private preferences by default.

## Fixed
- Added queries for opening browser from in-app

name: 6.0.0-rc2
body:
## Added
- Support for chat module
- Support for geo module

## Security improvements
- removed deprecated ECBCryptor from SDK, if you need to migrate check [ECB Cryptor Migration Guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/ECB-Cryptor-migration)
- `withPrivateSharedPrefs()`: Deprecated at 6.0.0 version, all data saved to private preferences by default.

name: 6.0.0-rc1
body:
# Release Candidate
This version contains only core modules, `infobip-mobile-messaging-android-geo-sdk` and `infobip-mobile-messaging-android-chat-sdk` modules aren't available.

## Changed
Check [Migration Guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide#migration-from-5x-to-6x-rc)
- Migrated to AndroidX
- firebase-messaging version changed to 22.0.0

## Fixed
- InApp chat compatibility with older versions of Android

## Fixed
- Fixed In-App Chat layout

## Fixed
- Bug with opening default application when user taps on message with provided `webViewUrl`. SDK opens URL in its default application unless it needs to be opened in a browser. Links which should be opened by default in browser app are trying to be opened directly in this WebView.

## Fixed
- Fixed layout issues in In-App Chat

## Fixed
- Minor bugs for saving Installation

## Changed
- proguard-rules changed in order to only keep what is inside our packages

## Added
- New API for getting and resetting unread chat push messages counter. [Documentation](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat#unread-chat-push-messages-counter)

## Changed
- In-app chat improvements of storing images captured from camera, `requestLegacyExternalStorage="true"` in `AndroidManifest.xml` not needed any more.

## Fixed
- Possible issue with wrong token after depersonalization
- Issue with usage of wrong application code if it’s changed for some app with the same namespace that could happen if migration happens from versions < 5.0.0 to one of latest SDKs
- Too often calling of base URL endpoint

## Changed
- In-App Chat attachment compression, for sending attachment captured from camera:
  1. if size is more than 5MB, reduce the quality to 80%
  2. if size is more than 10MB, reduce the quality to 80% and scale down size in 2 times.

## Fixed
- Fix of possible DLR delay in case of 2 different DLRs trying to be reported or messages synced in the same second
- NPE fix for custom attribute values mapping

## Fixed
- NPE fix for `getApplicationCode()` during token update and session reports
- IndexOutOfBoundsException fix in CustomAttributesMapper

## Fixed
- In-app chats background color for input field

## Changed
- First release to Maven Central Repository, [Migration guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide#migration-to-mavencentral---520-version)

## Fixed
- Proguard rules

## Changed
- Encryption algorithm changed to CBC, because ECB encryption mode should not be used.

## Added
- Disabling of modal in-app notification automatic displaying
- Method to display modal in-app notification, for particular message, if it's not expired

## Fixed
- In-app Chat input

## Added
- Internal mechanism for recovering dynamic API URL.
 
## Fixed
- Crash, while receiving in-app chat push message if current activity can't be cast to `AppCompatActivity`

## Fixed
- Fixed LiveChat input field

## Changed
- Minor changes for In-app chat Fragment support in plugins.

## Added
- Chat [sneak peek](https://www.infobip.com/docs/live-chat/agent-panel#typing-indicator-sneak-peek) feature.

## Fixed
- In-app notification notification image max size support for 3:2 ratio

## Fixed
- In-app notification was displayed immediately, when receiving signaling geo notification with in-app setting.

## Added
- support of [display in-app chat as fragment](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat#display-in-app-chat-as-fragment)

## Added: 
- Library event NOTIFICATION_DISPLAYED with notification ID and message as a payload. More details [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Library-events#notification_displayed)

## Added:
- Support for custom attribute of CustomList type on User entity
- Support for custom attribute of DateTime type on Installation and User entities

## Fixed
- Setting `isPrimary` flag fix

## Fixed
- Opening Play Store and other available schemes in dedicated apps when links are opened in WebViewActivity

## Fixed
- Low quality of in-app chat images uploaded from camera. Images captured from camera are resized to `MAX_HEIGHT = 1280.0f;` and `MAX_WIDTH = 720.0f;` and saved to `/Pictures/<Your app name>/InAppChat` folder

## Fixed
- not displaying chat notifications when user is on InAppChatActivity

## Fixed
- Minor UI bug for in-app chat attachment preview

## Fixed
- In-app chat issue with requesting permission of storing attachments for Android < 10.0.

## Added
- In-app chat, method for activation of chat service added - [wiki](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat#intro)
 
### Migrating from 3.x to 4.x
If you used previously in-app chat module, method for activation of chat service should be called before opening chat screen, it will start chat service, without it chat configuration will not be updated properly. Detailed instruction in [wiki](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat#intro)

## Fixed
- Issue on chat module for invoking WebView cleanup operation on wrong thread

## Added 
- In-app chat attachment preview

## Added
- Support of configurable text for default in-app open and dismiss buttons
- Internal installation ID header

## Fixed
- Issue on chat module for invoking WebView operations on wrong thread

## Added
- Support for handling primary button action for opening URLs in a browser app
- Support for deeplink parameter

## Fixed
- In-app chat attachments are sent now with file name

## Fixed
- Minor Issue with cleanup method

## Changed
- Internal refactoring for better Huawei support

## Added
- [In-app chat - Sending attachments](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat#sending-attachments)

## Fixed
- Minor bugs for personalization in case registration not yet available

## Fixed
- IllegalStateException on displaying of multiple in-app notifications
- In-app chat connection error handling minor issue

## Added
- In-app chat error state handling.

## Fixed
- Fix for multiple redundant calls for fetching of chat configuration

## Added
- In-app Chat, more info in Wiki - https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat
- Supported handling of URLs as a part of the WebViewActivity

## Fixed
- Sending of localized session bounds for events (not being localized anymore)

### Migrating from 2.x to 3.x
- Reimport classes `MobileMessagingError` and `Result` (package name changed):
  * old: `import org.infobip.mobile.messaging.mobile.MobileMessagingError;`, new: `import org.infobip.mobile.messaging.mobileapi.MobileMessagingError;`
  * old: `import org.infobip.mobile.messaging.mobile.Result;`, new: `import org.infobip.mobile.messaging.mobileapi.Result;`
- If you used previous chat module, it's completely rewritten and if used should be newly implemented by following guidelines provided [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In%E2%80%90app-chat)

## Changed
- Minor changes on convenience methods needed by plugins for events

## Changed
- Structure of packages for convenience methods needed by plugins 

## Fixed
- Issues with mapping of CustomEvent dates 
- Minor bugfixes

## Added
- Behavioural events in audience profiling. More details on [Wiki](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Events)

## Fixed
- Possible NPEs

## Fixed
- Streaming longer response body issues
- NPE fixes: on `depersonalizeInstallation(String, ResultListener)` method and for non-existent appCodeProvider class name

## Added
- Method `.withPrivateSharedPrefs()` on `MobileMessaging.Builder(context)`. If used, it will migrate all MobileMessaging data from public shared preferences to private storage under "MobileMessagingSDK" name maintaining the new private storage. Old public prefs will be deleted. Switching from using this library version with private shared prefs back to MM SDK version < 2.2.0 is not backwards compatible since older SDK versions use just public prefs by default (and by using this method only private prefs are maintained)
 
## Changed
- Using only Firebase for push messaging. `play-services-gcm` dependency cannot be used from this version. If you want to use GCM, we suggest you to use version 2.1.1
- Gradle 5.4.1, build tools 3.5.0, Firebase messaging updated to latest minor versions (non breaking changes), code-style fixes
 
## Fixed
- Possible NPEs
- Optimization of unnecessary network calls

# Important!
#### This version is using GCM components even if you've set up everything to work with just Firebase. Downgrading from this version to versions below 2.2.0 will result in exception when notification is received.
### Provided fix (using Firebase only by default) will be available with version 2.3.0 that will be backwards compatible.

## Fixed
- Handling of push over GCMReceiver class - not displaying push over GCM receiver if it doesn't have message body
- Optimization of unnecessary network calls

# Important!
#### This version is using Firebase components and update from all versions below 2.2.0 will be seamless. If you were using versions 2.2.0 or 2.2.1 your app will crash with exception when notification is received.
### If you've used 2.2.0 or 2.2.1, DO NOT use this version but update to 2.3.+.

## Fixed
- *IMPORTANT*: GCM is always used as PushServiceType instead of Firebase on versions 2.2.0 and 2.2.1. Reported [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/issues/17)

# Important!
#### This version is using GCM components even if you've set up everything to work with just Firebase. Downgrading from this version to versions below 2.2.0 will result in exception when notification is received.
### Provided fix (using Firebase only by default) will be available with version 2.3.0 that will be backwards compatible.

## Fixed
- Possible NPEs

# Important!
#### This version is using GCM components even if you've set up everything to work with just Firebase. Downgrading from this version to versions below 2.2.0 will result in exception when notification is received.
### Provided fix (using Firebase only by default) will be available with version 2.3.0 that will be backwards compatible.

## Added
- Method `.withPrivateSharedPrefs()` on `MobileMessaging.Builder(context)`. If used, it will migrate all MobileMessaging data from public shared preferences to private storage under "MobileMessagingSDK" name maintaining the new private storage. Old public prefs will be deleted. Switching from using this library version with private shared prefs back to MM SDK version < 2.2.0 is not backwards compatible since older SDK versions use just public prefs by default (and by using this method only private prefs are maintained)
 
## Changed
- Gradle 5.4.1, build tools 3.5.0, Firebase messaging and GCM updated to latest minor versions (non breaking changes), code-style fixes
 
## Fixed
- Possible NPEs

## Fixed
- Avoiding unnecessary network requests for background sync
- Fixed NPE on migration from 1.x to 2.x SDK which might happen on the first calling of MobileMessaging.build() method.

## Added
- Option for setting notification [accent color](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Notification.html#color). Check the usage [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Notification-settings#notification-accent-color).
- Enabled handling of no registration state

## Fixed
- IllegalArgumentException exception on MobileMessagingLogger class logged as: `com.android.org.bouncycastle.jce.exception.ExtCertPathValidatorException declares multiple JSON fields`

## Fixed
- Condition for syncing the internal "pushServiceType" parameter

## Fixed
- "NoSuchFieldException" bug related to obfuscation for Gradle 3.4.0 and wrapper 5.1.1 reported here https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/issues/12

## Fixed
- Removed sending of redundant geo generated message IDs in seen requests

## Changed
- Force updating of cloud token (delete old, acquire new) when push service type is changed - should fix possible issues with outdated token related to migration from GCM to Firebase

## Fixed
- HTTP connection issues when falling back to untrusted mode

## Fixed
- SecurityException in JobIntentService since Android O (Android versions 8+). More about the original issue: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/63622293

## Fixed
- Connection to server when SSL handhake error happens
- Proguard issues with gson

## Fixed
- Notification settings local storing
- Version checks disabled for plugins

## Fixed
- Proper query parameters for http requests

## Changed
- Error code cleanup, check up error codes here: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Server-errors
- In-code docs updated

## Fixed
- Bug with displaying an in-app dialog when GCM is used and in app is set to false (not displaying it now)

## Added
- New error code in personalize API: AMBIGUOUS_PERSONALIZE_CANDIDATES

## Fixed
- Duplicated background processing of creating an installation

## Fixed
- Class cast exception when user attributes are provided in personalize method
- User persisting

## Added
- Handling absence of WAKE_LOCK permission for token and message handling

## Changed
- Removed apache dependency for Base64 encoding.

## Fixed
- Mapping of UserIdentity for personalize request

## Added
main new features:
- *trusted devices* - List if all devices connected to the same Person.
- *trusted devices management* - Possibility to manage from any connected devices the other  devices primary flag and perform unpersonalise (logout) for other devices. So that the other device becomes anonymous. In fact with this feature from trusted device you can remove other trusted device from Person profile. Very nice feature for banks. 
- *Person data* - Persona data is in sync to all trusted devices. All you can see in Portal as Standard attributes you will see the same in mobile app. (at least for demo case)
- *Tags* - Tags from Portal 😄 you can build now cases similar to abandonded cart
- *Custom Attributes* - the same Custom Attributes as Person on Portal has
- *Custom Device Data* - this is data on device level and belongs only to a particular device and can't be shared between devices.

[Migration guide](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Migration-guide)

## Added
- Support for banner notifications (heads-up) when the application is in foreground

## Fixed
- Duplicated message broadcasts when going from offline to online

## Fixed
- Unpropagated FCM as service type in case when app is migrated from GCM to FCM (doesn't affect case when token is updated).

## Fixed
- NPE when imageUrl contains empty bitmap
- Saving user data (but not sending it to server) when logout is in progress

## Added
- Support for using custom FirebaseMessagingService class. Read the instructions [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/How-can-I-achieve-handling-by-Infobip's-Firebase-and-my-Firebase-messaging-service%3F)

## Added
- Sending operating system language within system data

## Fixed
- Fixed NPE on `java.lang.String org.infobip.mobile.messaging.Message.getMessageId()` when Proguard is applied and Firebase message not serialized

## Added
- Firebase as a default cloud messaging service. Read more about migration from GCM to Firebase on [Google's official docs](https://developers.google.com/cloud-messaging/faq).
- Google Services Gradle Plugin support. We're now reading project number from your `google-services.json` file if it's present. In case you don’t use it, you can still put `google_app_id` string to your resources as stated [here](https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android#quick-start-guide) - bullet 5.
 
## Changed
- Android compile/target version to API level 28.
 
## Deprecated
- GCM as a default - now using Firebase. If for some reason you still need to use GCM, it will be used if it's present on classpath (in app’s build.gradle) as a compatibility feature. Otherwise, if you don't need GCM, please remove it as a dependency since this version is using FCM as a default.

## Added
- Improved logging for geo

## Fixed
- Issues during error handling in SDK

## Added
- Error callback API for initialization.

## Added
- New APIs to get data from the server.
 
## Changed
- Reduced number of automatic network requests.

## Fixed
- Fixing transitive dependencies before publishing to bintray

## Fixed
- Added resources as transitive dependency

## Changed
- All in-app and interactive functionality is now built-in into the main SDK module.

## Fixed
- Not allowing logout without registration
- Fixed exception on android 8+ when notifications disabled

## Added
- Support for in-app notifications for geo messages

## Changed
- Removed sha1 apache dependencies in sdk

## Changed
- Minor internal refactoring

## Fixed
- NoClassDefFoundError for MobileMessagingJobService on versions below Android N (7.0)
Maintenance release

## Added
- Primary sync apis
- Improvements to throttling

## Added
- Support for in-app notifications for silent messages

## Fixed
- Error log prints on geo disable

## Added
- Offline support for logout method without callback. If logout without callback is called when there's no connectivity, then SDK will manage it on itself and perform it whenever appropriate.

## Changed
- Added manifest verification during library startup.
- Error logging improved.

## Fixed
- Business logic updates for setting and getting primary

## Fixed
 - Firebase compatibility issues which led to crashes on Android v 8 when the message is received

## Added
 - Methods to get/set primary setting for push registration. Can be used when targeting one or multiple registrations of one user.

## Fixed
- Added built-in theme for in-app dialog to work under non-appcompat activities

## Fixed
- Added transitive dependency to appcompat

## Fixed
- Not sending message to server for default in-app actions (open/cancel)
- Proper foreground activity detection when going up from background

## Fixed
- Bugfix for RTE when in-app alert was started with background context

## Added
- In-app alerts for non-actionable notifications. From now on all the messages (either requiring and not requiring user interaction) that you send with in-app alert enabled flag SDK will automatically bring up within in-app alert with content from the message when user opens the app.
More details here: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In-app-notifications

## Fixed
- Bugfix for exception when handling action press in notification

## Fixed
- Bugfix for NPE when receiving in-app message in background

## Added
- Triggering action tapped event upon tapping on button in in-app dialog.

## Added
- In-app alerts for actionable notifications. From now on you can send a message with in-app alert enabled and then when user opens the app, SDK will automatically bring up In-app alert with the content from the message.
More details here: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/In-app-notifications

## Added
- Chat feature within new SDK module that enables chat conversation between participants using SDK and HTTP APIs. Feature and implementation details are described here: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Chat.

## Added
- Introduced `logout()` method for logging out user: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/User-logout. By calling the method `UserData` associated with the device will be cleaned up on the Infobip Platform and the SDK. You can use this method on the user logged out from the application event, so that this device won’t be targeted with user’s personalized messages until new data sync.

## Fixed
- Bugfix for crash when telephony manager returns malformed network operator

## Added
- Enabled support for heads-up notifications by default: https://github.com/infobip/mobile-messaging-sdk-android/wiki/Notification-settings#heads-up-notifications

## Changed
- Not retrieving token every time when checking for existence of Play Services on device
- Checking for existence of application code before sending token to server

## Changed
- Minor improvements to interactive notification APIs for better cordova support.

## Fixed
- Avoiding false-positive cleanup for devices with a fresh installation.
- Will also not call GMS for devices without play services

## Changed
- Date type instead of a String for user data birth date setter/getter

## Fixed
- Security exceptions on acquiring network data for some Android devices that require read phone state permission for SIM operator data

## Fixed
- Exceptions during geo reporting from background service threads

## Removed
- Telephone number as it is being deprecated in favor of msisdn (gsm).

### Added
- Dynamic base url management and http deserialization fixes

### Fixed
- C2D permissions in manifest.

### Added
- Application code verification.

### Changed
- Handling new backend endpoint and new service errors for user data sync

### Changed
- Using current time as sent timestamp for generated geo messages.

### Fixed
- Interoperability issues with Firebase, avoiding duplicate notifications

### Added
- Android O channel support
- IMPORTANT - notifications built by MM SDK **ARE NOT** displayed on 1.8.0 version due to missing notification channel. You'll need to update to this version (1.8.1) for this to work 

### Fixed
- Android O background processes support

### Added
- Bulk ID and internal message ID to MO message model

### Changed
- Improved internal handling of modules

### Changed
- Using JobScheduler to listen for connectivity changes on Android N+

### Fixes
- Bug-fixes for connectivity handling for Android versions below N

### Fixes
- Bug-fix for serialization of nested objects inside customPayload of Message

### Fixes
- Bug-fix for Android 7+ - exceptions in connectivity change listener

### Fixes
- Bug-fix for Android O - Illegal exception: Broadcast already finished when notification is received

### Added
- Retry on internet reconnected

### Added
- Proguard configuration extended to keep needed classes
- New MobileMessaging API method to retrieve pushRegistrationId

### Added
- Input for notification actions
- Sent timestamp for push messages

### Fixed
- SQL migration fixes for internal data

### Changed
- Do not broadcast internal errors for under-the-hood synchronization.

### Added
- Retries for network messages sent via interactive notifications.
 
### Changed
- HTTP layer handling in library.
- New retry engine.
 
### Fixed
- Minor bugfixes.

### Fixed
- Aborting FCM default broadcast (might invoke duplicated notifications)

### Fixed
- Bug in default notification handler: only last notification click was leading to CallbackActivity. Now click on each notification leads to the CallbackActivity set up in NotificationSettings.

### Changed
- Interactive notifications separated from SDK module to interactive module (both predefined and custom categories)

### Added
- Interactive notifications support (predefined and custom categories)

### Added
- Handling of time and date changes for geo campaigns
- Logging improvements
- Cleanup logic for geofencing engine
 
### Fixed
- Minor bugfixes for message fetching and reporting
- Fix for token cleanup procedure

### Fixed
- Bugfixes for cleanup
- Geofencing bugfixes

### Added
- Additional verbose logging for debug configurations

### Changed
- Optimizations and bugfixes for message fetching.

### Fixed
- MO message deserialization problems on certain android versions

### Added
- Backend synchronization of device lock enabled info

### Added
- Doing synchronization with server when application goes to foreground.

### Fixed
- Avoiding multiple delivery requests for the same message

### Changed
- Improvements for media content handling

### Changed
- Minor improvements.

### Changed
- Minor improvements for handling of notification images

### Changed
- Display image in notification

### Changed
- Location permission added to AndroidManifest.xml in geo SDK library

### Changed
- Geofencing service was moved to a separate module and is not being installed by default. This helps to reduce app size footprint for those apps that don't use Geofencing.

### Fixed
- Bugfix for optional Application Code persisting

### Added
- Optional Application Code persisting

### Added
- Optional User Data persisting

### Fixed
- Minor bug fixes for geofencing

### Fixed
- SecurityException invoked on boot completed event - geo related

### Fixed
- Bug-fix - missing NotificationTapReceiver default constructor

bdec774 Merge pull request #87 in MML/infobip-mobile-messaging-android from pandric-MM-1148-cordova-messageTapped-event to master
9c255a3 [Gradle Release Plugin] - new version commit:  '1.5.0-SNAPSHOT'.

ecacc8d [Gradle Release Plugin] - new version commit:  '1.5.0-SNAPSHOT'.

bc0ae39 Enforcing package for broadcast intents
ee52a4a Merge pull request #85 in MML/infobip-mobile-messaging-android from pandric-MM-1464-change-sync-mIDs-storage-to-set to master
2e75fe2 [Gradle Release Plugin] - new version commit:  '1.5.0-SNAPSHOT'.

7fa147a Adding message extra with BroadcastParameter to tap handling activity
2707b7b [Gradle Release Plugin] - new version commit:  '1.5.0-SNAPSHOT'.

e7a67d8 Merge pull request #84 in MML/infobip-mobile-messaging-android from sslavin-foreground to master
4c8937c [Gradle Release Plugin] - new version commit:  '1.5.0-SNAPSHOT'.

838210d Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

b8dad0d Fixed ninfobip typos in properties
cf2f281 MM-1410 - Merged geo tests and clock to master
99696cc MM-1410 - Refactoring and fixes
